skill.name: Testing Skill
skill.description: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.summary: Automated test generation, review, and execution for pytest-based projects.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing only markdown guidance for testing practices. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond the skill documentation itself. Purely a prompt-based skill.

content.user_title: Generate and Review Tests with AI
content.value_statement: Writing comprehensive tests takes significant developer time and expertise. This skill automates test generation, review, and execution for pytest projects with patterns like AAA and fixtures.
actual_capabilities: Generate unit and integration tests for Python functions
Review existing tests for quality and coverage gaps
Apply testing patterns like mutation testing
limitations: Does not execute tests in live environments

use_cases.title: Rapid Test Creation
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive unit tests for functions and classes with AAA pattern and fixtures.

use_cases.title: Quality Gate Enforcement
use_cases.description: Review test suites for coverage gaps and enforce 80% minimum coverage standards.

use_cases.title: End-to-End Testing
use_cases.description: Implement integration and e2e tests for full system validation with security and performance checks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Unit Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write unit tests for [function/module] using pytest with AAA pattern. Include edge cases and typical scenarios.

prompt_templates.title: Fixture Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create pytest fixtures for [component] that provide [test data/setup]. Show how to use them in tests.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Write integration tests for [module] that test interaction with [dependency/service]. Mock external calls.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze [test file/module] for coverage gaps. Identify untested branches and suggest tests to achieve 80% coverage.

best_practices: Use AAA pattern (Arrange-Act-Assert) for clear, maintainable tests
Maintain at least 80% code coverage with branch coverage enabled
Keep tests isolated and independent with no execution order dependencies
anti_patterns: Avoid mixing test logic with production code in test files
Do not rely on test execution order or shared state between tests
Avoid complex assertions that hide multiple test conditions

faq.question: Which Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Python 3.8+ projects using pytest. Coverage requires pytest-cov plugin.

faq.question: What test frameworks work with this skill?
faq.answer: Designed for pytest only. Limited compatibility with unittest-style tests through pytest adapters.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Use pytest commands with coverage flags. CI should fail if coverage drops below 80% threshold.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. Tests run locally in your environment. No test data is sent externally.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing after generation?
faq.answer: Generated tests may need adjustment for complex dependencies. Review assertions and mock external services.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub Copilot testing?
faq.answer: Provides structured testing workflows with patterns like AAA, fixtures, and coverage enforcement specific to pytest projects.
